definition: incorporating diverse things (idiom)/eclectic/all-embracing
double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
and/furthermore/also/together with/(not) at all/simultaneously/to combine/to join/to merge
to combine/to amalgamate
variant of 並|并[bing4]
to store up/to grow (e.g. a beard)/to entertain (ideas)

sentences.english: Probable the best answer is a synthesis of all five.
sentences.chinese: 也许最佳的答案是对五种方法采取兼收并蓄的态度。

sentences.english: It's all eclectic, but it all works together.
sentences.chinese: 一切都兼收并蓄，但所有一起工作。

to include and monopolize many things/all-embracing
to blend/to integrate/to amalgamate/to fuse
all rivers run into the sea/use different means to obtain the same result (idiom)
to have a style of one's own
not stick to one pattern
fusion/to combine as one
to have unique (talent, insight etc)
China and the West/Chinese-Western
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
stick-in-the-mud/to stick to old ways/stubbornly conservative
to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate

to take the best/to absorb the essence
